response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "Being 18 years old indicates a young age, which is associated with higher recidivism risk due to less maturity and potential for impulsive behavior."],
    ["Gender", "medium", "Being male is statistically correlated with higher levels of criminal behavior, contributing moderately to recidivism risk."],
    ["Race", "low", "While race is noted, it is not a direct causal factor; any observed differences are often due to systemic biases and other socio-economic factors."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "Having been arrested 19 times and having convictions is a strong indicator of future recidivism."],
    ["Education", "high", "Lacking a high school diploma or GED is strongly linked to recidivism risk due to reduced opportunities and higher likelihood of reoffending."],
    ["Employment", "high", "Not holding any jobs in the past year indicates economic instability, which is a significant risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Drug Use", "medium", "Recent drug use (marijuana and cocaine) in the past four years adds to recidivism risk, though its influence is moderate compared to criminal history."],
    ["Marital Status", "low", "Being never married can have a slight risk association, but it is generally a weaker predictor of recidivism on its own."],
    ["Living Situation", "low", "Living alone may contribute minimally to isolation, but it is not a strong stand-alone predictor of recidivism."],
    ["Religious Beliefs", "medium", "Expressing that God has nothing to do with personal life may indicate lower social and community support or moral guidance, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Family Background", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household of 4 with biological family may suggest exposure to environmental risk factors, though this is moderately predictive."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 80
}

risk_factors: Being 18 years old indicates a young age, which is associated with higher recidivism risk due to less maturity and potential for impulsive behavior.
Being male is statistically correlated with higher levels of criminal behavior, contributing moderately to recidivism risk.
While race is noted, it is not a direct causal factor; any observed differences are often due to systemic biases and other socio-economic factors.
Having been arrested 19 times and having convictions is a strong indicator of future recidivism.
Lacking a high school diploma or GED is strongly linked to recidivism risk due to reduced opportunities and higher likelihood of reoffending.
Not holding any jobs in the past year indicates economic instability, which is a significant risk factor for recidivism.
Recent drug use (marijuana and cocaine) in the past four years adds to recidivism risk, though its influence is moderate compared to criminal history.
Being never married can have a slight risk association, but it is generally a weaker predictor of recidivism on its own.
Living alone may contribute minimally to isolation, but it is not a strong stand-alone predictor of recidivism.
Expressing that God has nothing to do with personal life may indicate lower social and community support or moral guidance, contributing moderately to risk.
Growing up in an urban household of 4 with biological family may suggest exposure to environmental risk factors, though this is moderately predictive.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 19 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 9 inches and weighs 185 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
